Target E-Commerce Revenue Analysis

Dashboard 3: Seller Performance Analysis

Purpose

This dashboard focuses on analyzing seller performance based on revenue and product count across selected timeframes and product categories. It aims to provide insights into top-performing sellers and their contributions to overall revenue and product sales.

Key Insights

  • Observation 1: The top-performing category, Health & Beauty, accounts for 8.59% of all products sold and 9.08% of total revenue. In comparison, Gift Watches contributes 5.34% of all products sold but 8.33% of total revenue, reflecting its higher-value, lower-volume order nature.
  • Observation 2: Within the top 5 categories, which together comprise 38% of all products sold and 39.25% of total revenue, the top 5 sellers collectively contribute 15.84% of total revenue, highlighting their critical role in driving performance in key product segments.
  • Observation 3: For Gift Watches, the top 5 sellers dominate the category, contributing 62.11% of its total revenue and 67.13% of its total products sold, despite there being only 51 sellers in the category. In contrast, Health & Beauty, with 384 sellers, has its top 5 sellers contributing only 18.03% of total products sold and 9.08% of its total revenue, emphasizing the disparity in seller concentration and distribution between these categories.
  • Observation 4: The top seller for Gift Watches generated $202k in revenue, compared to the top seller for Health & Beauty, who achieved only $78k, showcasing the difference in average order value and seller performance between these two categories.

Dashboard Features and Sections

Filters and Slicers

Purpose: Enables users to dynamically filter the data by time (year, quarter, and month), product categories, and selected metrics.
Features:

  • Time Slicer: Allows users to filter data by year, quarter, and month.
  • Product Category Slicer: Lets users select specific product categories to view, dynamically updating titles and visualizations.
  • Selected Metric Slicer:
    • Allows users to toggle between Percentage of Revenue and Percentage of Total Products metrics.
    • Dynamically updates all relevant visualizations to reflect the selected metric.
    • To learn more about the Selected Metric measure, click here.

Screenshots

Category Slicer

Time Slicer

Selected Metric Toggle

KPI Cards

Purpose: Provides a snapshot of key performance indicators based on the applied filters.
Features:

  • Revenue %: Displays the percentage contribution of the selected dataset to the total revenue.
  • Product %: Displays the percentage contribution of the selected dataset to the total product count.
  • Shortened Top Seller ID: Displays the first eight characters of the top seller ID based on total revenue. This card does not change based on the selected metric.
Insights:
  • In Health & Beauty, 8.59% of all products and 9.08% of total revenue were attributed to this category.
  • The top seller ID by revenue in Health & Beauty was edb1ef5e....

Screenshots

Revenue Percentage

Product Count Percentage

Shortened Top Seller ID

Visualizations

1. Top 5 Sellers by Metric and Category

Purpose: Displays the performance of the top 5 sellers based on the selected metric and product category.
Features:

  • A scatter chart showing 5 seller IDs, with bubble size mapped to the selected metric and color mapped to product categories.
  • Dynamically updates based on selected categories and metrics.
  • Displays a dynamic callout such as, "The Top 5 Sellers contribute 25.71% of total revenue in Health & Beauty."
  • When multiple categories are selected, the visual still displays the top 5 sellers based on cumulative totals across selected categories.

Screenshots

2. Seller Rankings by Metric and Category

Purpose: Provides a detailed table of seller rankings based on revenue and product count, allowing for direct comparison of metrics.
Features:

  • Columns include:
    1. Seller Rank
    2. seller_id
    3. Total Product Revenue
    4. Product Count
    5. Selected Metric
    6. Weighted Average Revenue
  • Conditional highlighting for the top 5 sellers by revenue, with ranks and rows highlighted in orange.
  • Dynamically updates based on selected metric and category filters.
Insights:
  • The seller with the highest revenue may not always have the highest product count, leading to reordered rankings when toggling metrics.
  • For example, the seller with the highest revenue in Health & Beauty only ranked 9th by product count.

Screenshots

Insights in Action

  • Revenue Maximization: Focus efforts on categories like Gift Watches, where the top 5 sellers generate a significant share of both revenue and product sales, despite having fewer sellers overall. This indicates a strong opportunity to leverage high-value orders.
  • Seller Strategy: Analyze the strategies employed by top sellers in Gift Watches to replicate success in other categories. Encourage underperforming sellers in Health & Beauty to target higher-value orders to improve revenue contributions.
  • Category Growth: Consider expanding seller participation in categories like Gift Watches to diversify revenue sources while supporting high-performing sellers in Health & Beauty to further optimize their sales.
  • Resource Allocation: Allocate marketing and promotional resources toward the top 5 product categories, which account for a substantial share of revenue (39.25%), ensuring high-impact efforts across these critical areas.

Measures Used

This section provides an overview of the key measures used in this dashboard. For a look at all measures used across my analysis, refer to the DAX Measures Document. Otherwise, use the links below to navigate to the respective measure.

  • Percentage of Revenue: Displays the revenue percentage contribution of the selected dataset. Learn more.
  • Percentage of Total Products: Displays the product count percentage contribution of the selected dataset. Learn more.
